issue.title: Missing splitted filters for the "Report an issue" form.
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

These new splitted filters are missing for the "Report an issue" form. If the user enables one of them and tries to report a issue, they will not appear in the form. Only the "AdGuard Annoyances" filter appears in the form.

<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![Form](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35523759/180346872-6c5e98c1-8c2f-44d8-bca1-694902a9c441.png)
</details>

### Proposed solution

Add splitted filters (AdGuard Cookie Notices, Popups, Mobile App Banners, Other Annoyances and Widgets) to "Report an issue" form.

### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body:
I can reproduce it, but this is a limitation of Mozilla to load JS rules.
You should wait for a new release of the extension or add a rule to user rules.
```
tomshw.it#%#AG_onLoad(function(){if(-1==document.cookie.indexOf("euconsent-v2")){var d=new MutationObserver(function(){var a=!1,e=document.querySelector("button.iubenda-cs-accept-btn");e&&(e.click(),a=!0),null===document.querySelector("button.iubenda-cs-accept-btn")&&a&&d.disconnect()});d.observe(document,{childList:!0,subtree:!0,attributes:!0}),setTimeout(function(){d.disconnect()},1E4)}});
```

pull_request.title: generic rules for some japanese websites
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [ ] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

* Fix #124800
* Fix #124797
* Fix #124798

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

Upon analysis last night, it worries me that most `www.city.*.jp` sites would use *completely* different element trees and names, such that finding recurring patterns on more than 3 reported sites proved futile. And even then, `##a[rel=nofollow][href*="/ban/pub/default.aspx?"]` was one of only three 3-site patterns I could find.

Additionally, I'm adding `###fBanArea.floating` for the sake of `https://www.pref.saga.lg.jp/`

2. Screenshots

N/A (Covered by the original threads)

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.body: Ok.

pull_request.title: generic rules for some japanese websites
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [ ] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

* Fix #124800
* Fix #124797
* Fix #124798

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

Upon analysis last night, it worries me that most `www.city.*.jp` sites would use *completely* different element trees and names, such that finding recurring patterns on more than 3 reported sites proved futile. And even then, `##a[rel=nofollow][href*="/ban/pub/default.aspx?"]` was one of only three 3-site patterns I could find.

Additionally, I'm adding `###fBanArea.floating` for the sake of `https://www.pref.saga.lg.jp/`

2. Screenshots

N/A (Covered by the original threads)

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.body: I guess we can add it and see how it goes.

pull_request.title: Add iOS-compatible regex for too common revolving adservers
pull_request.body:
## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

Those regex
```
/^https?:\/\/(?:www\.)?[a-z0-9-]{5,}\.(?:com|bid|online|top|club)\/[0-9a-f]{32}\/invoke\.js/$script,third-party
/^https?:\/\/(?:www\.|[a-z0-9]{7,10}\.)?[a-z0-9-]{5,}\.(?:com|bid|link|live|online|top|club)\/(?:[a-z0-9]{2}\/){2,3}[a-f0-9]{32}\.js/$script,xmlhttprequest,third-party
```
have been catching so many revolving adservers for years, but are not compatible to CB. The result is iOS users see a lot more ads/popup by them than other platforms.

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

Many, I'm sure you know.

### Enter the issue address

An example of the first regex is currently seen on `www.tvsubtitles.net​` and the second `avgle.com` on my side, but they may change.

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

I don't know whether `(?:www\.)?` works on CB so didn't add. Tell me if it works. I concentrated on covering as much targets by as simple regex as possible.

- Almost 100% of them now use .com domain
- There are certainly cases starting from www or pl******* but rather rare
- `(?:[a-z0-9]{2}\/)` repeated only two times is rare

Also the original regex put in specific.txt seems to be only historical reason, they are generic pattern so moved to general_url.txt.

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.body: :) Ok, please show few urls, matched by these regexes.

issue.title: mail.yandex.ru

labels.name: Extra
labels.description: Issues, related to AdGuard Extra extension

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
### ВНИМАНИЕ

Пользователям программы для `Windows`, `macOS` или `Android` нужно включить расширение `AdGuard Extra` в настройках программы.

---

Пользователям браузерного расширения нужно установить [расширение AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra#how-to-install-adguard-extra) либо скрипт `AdGuard Extra`(этот вариант может не везде срабатыавать). 

<details><summary>Установка скрипта  "AdGuard Extra" в расширение "Tampermonkey"  :</summary>

Для установки скрипта понадобится браузерное расширение-скриптоприёмник `Tampermonkey`

Ссылка на `AdGuard Extra`
https://userscripts.adtidy.org/beta/adguard-extra/1.0/adguard-extra.user.js

После установки скрипта нужно будет зайти в настройки `Tampermonkey`, включить режим эксперта, переключить режим встраивания на `мгновенный` и перезапустить расширение:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8361299/62641343-07248e00-b94c-11e9-9775-9854a7922889.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8361299/62641299-f7a54500-b94b-11e9-8a83-885d89abbeec.png)

</details>

comment.body:
> Проблема возникла после обновления OS X до версии 12.5. Не блокируется вся реклама на портале mail.yandex.ru. В других вкладках (на других сайтах) с теми же настройками фильтрация осуществляется

Для Safari нужен Tampermonkey. Но он платный.

issue.title: logapi.zhipin.com
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Windows

### AdGuard version

7.10.1 (build 3960, CL 1.9.76)

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed analytics or tracker

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Microsoft Edge

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.zhipin.com

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Chinese filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard DNS filter, AdGuard Experimental filter, Fanboy's Annoyances, Adblock Warning Removal List, I don't care about cookies

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Send Do-Not-Track header, Block WebRTC, Block Push API, Block Location API

### Add your comment and screenshots

This site's own tracker.
> Request URL: https://logapi.zhipin.com/dap/api/json

The third-party map API used by this site, the map API has trackers.
> Request URL: https://restapi.amap.com/v3/log/init?s=rsv3&product=JsInit&key=60085a6ee91616cf689ce0321e1f30c4&t=1658495796398&resolution=1664*991&mob=0&vt=1&dpr=1&scale=1&detect=false&callback=jsonp_211593_&platform=JS&logversion=2.0&sdkversion=1.3



<details><summary>screenshots</summary>
![Imgur](https://i.imgur.com/wwuEmI7.png)
</details>




### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

pull_request.title: Add iOS-compatible regex for too common revolving adservers
pull_request.body:
## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

Those regex
```
/^https?:\/\/(?:www\.)?[a-z0-9-]{5,}\.(?:com|bid|online|top|club)\/[0-9a-f]{32}\/invoke\.js/$script,third-party
/^https?:\/\/(?:www\.|[a-z0-9]{7,10}\.)?[a-z0-9-]{5,}\.(?:com|bid|link|live|online|top|club)\/(?:[a-z0-9]{2}\/){2,3}[a-f0-9]{32}\.js/$script,xmlhttprequest,third-party
```
have been catching so many revolving adservers for years, but are not compatible to CB. The result is iOS users see a lot more ads/popup by them than other platforms.

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

Many, I'm sure you know.

### Enter the issue address

An example of the first regex is currently seen on `www.tvsubtitles.net​` and the second `avgle.com` on my side, but they may change.

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

I don't know whether `(?:www\.)?` works on CB so didn't add. Tell me if it works. I concentrated on covering as much targets by as simple regex as possible.

- Almost 100% of them now use .com domain
- There are certainly cases starting from www or pl******* but rather rare
- `(?:[a-z0-9]{2}\/)` repeated only two times is rare

Also the original regex put in specific.txt seems to be only historical reason, they are generic pattern so moved to general_url.txt.

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met
